extendedIngredients.name: deep dish pie crust
extendedIngredients.original: Place the dish in the oven, cooking for 15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through. Remove the packets and serve, allowing each diner to open their own fish. Enjoy!

extendedIngredients.name: pan-fried bacon
extendedIngredients.original: Fold up the ends of the paper, twisting them in to create a packet. Place the packet in a Pyrex dish or roasting pan. Repeat with the other filet of fish.

title: Tilapia En Papillote with Cherry Tomatoes, Peppers & Olives
summary: Tilapian En Papillote with Cherry Tomatoes, Peppers & Olives might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 2 servings with 985 calories, 76g of protein, and 22g of fat each. For $7.91 per serving, this recipe covers 57% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and pescatarian diet. A mixture of cherry tomatoes, garlic clove, lemon juice, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. With a spoonacular score of 89%, this dish is spectacular. Similar recipes include Sole en Papillote with Tomatoes and Olives, Branzino En Papillote With Roasted Peppers, Black Olives And Fe, and Chicken En Papillote With Basil and Cherry Tomatoes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.
